workflow.name: Transcribe & analyze Telegram voice messages with AssemblyAI & GPT-4.1 to Gmail
workflow.description:
## Telegram Voice ‚Üí AI Summary & Sentiment Analysis via Gmail

This n8n template demonstrates how to capture Telegram voice messages, transcribe them into text using AssemblyAI, analyze the transcript with AI for summary and sentiment insights, and finally deliver a structured email report via Gmail.

## Use cases
- Automating meeting or lecture voice note transcriptions.  
- Gathering student feedback or training session insights from voice messages.  
- Quickly summarizing Telegram-delivered audio inputs into structured reports.  
- Reducing manual effort in capturing sentiment and key action items from conversations.  

## How it works
1. A voice message is sent to a connected Telegram Bot.  
2. The workflow fetches the file and uploads it to AssemblyAI.  
3. AssemblyAI generates a transcript from the audio.  
4. The transcript is analyzed by OpenAI to extract:  
   - Executive summary (120‚Äì180 words)  
   - Sentiment label and score  
   - Key points  
   - Action items (if any)  
   - Notable quotes  
   - Topics  
5. The formatted analysis is sent as an email report using Gmail.  
6. The workflow ends with a clean summary email containing actionable insights.  

## How to use
1. Import this workflow into your n8n instance.  
2. Set up and connect the required credentials:  
   - Telegram Bot API token  
   - AssemblyAI API key  
   - OpenAI API key  
   - Gmail OAuth2 account  
3. Replace placeholders (e.g., `<<YOUR_EMAIL ID>>` and `<<YOUR_ASSEMBLYAI_API_KEY>>`) with your actual values.  
4. Start the workflow. Whenever a voice message is received on the Telegram Bot, the workflow will process it end-to-end and deliver a polished email report.  

## Requirements
- Telegram Bot account (API token)  
- AssemblyAI account with API key  
- OpenAI account with API key  
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials configured in n8n  
- Active n8n instance  

## Customising this workflow
You can customize the email formatting, sentiment thresholds, or extend the workflow to save transcripts into Google Drive, Airtable, or any other connected apps. Additionally, you can trigger the same workflow from multiple input sources (e.g., local audio files, Google Drive links, or Telegram).

workflow.name: Telegram Voice Message_Audio Transcription--> AI summary & Sentiment Analysis--> Gmail delivery

parameters.content:
# Execution flow from Telegram
#### Send a voice message on Telegram
# Generate Transcript from Voice to text
# Generate summary, Sentiment Analysis and send E-mail

values.content: You are a precise meeting analyst. Output must be valid JSON only.

=Analyze the following transcript and return strict JSON:

Transcript:
{{ $node["Get Transcript"].json["text"] }}

Requirements:
- summary: 120‚Äì180 words, crisp and neutral
- sentiment_label: one of ["Positive","Neutral","Negative"]
- sentiment_score: number from -1 to 1
- key_points: 5‚Äì8 bullet points (short phrases)
- action_items: array of {owner, task, due?} if present, else []
- notable_quotes: array of short verbatim quotes (<=120 chars)
- topics: 3‚Äì6 tags

Return JSON with keys in snake_case:
{
  "summary": "...",
  "sentiment_label": "Positive",
  "sentiment_score": 0.64,
  "key_points": ["..."],
  "action_items": [{"owner":"Alice","task":"...","due":"2025-09-30"}],
  "notable_quotes": ["..."],
  "topics": ["...","..."]
}
No preamble or Markdown‚ÄîJSON only.

parameters.subject:
=Transcript summary & sentiment ‚Äì 
 {{ $now.toISO() }}

parameters.content:
# Try it Out!

### Capture voice messages from Telegram, transcribe them with AssemblyAI, analyze with AI for summary, key points, action items, and sentiment insights, and get a polished Gmail report.
###  Perfect for SMBs that record meetings as voice notes instead of using Zoom or Teams.

## How it works

### - A voice message is sent to your Telegram Bot  
### - The audio file is uploaded to AssemblyAI  
### - AssemblyAI generates the transcript  
### - OpenAI analyzes the text to create:  
 ### - Summary  
 ### - Sentiment label & score  
 ### - Key points  
 ### - Action items  
 ### - Notable quotes  
 ### - Topics  
### -  Gmail sends the formatted transcript analysis as a structured email report  

## How to use

 ### - Import this workflow into n8n  
 ### - Configure credentials:  
  ### - Telegram Bot API token  
  ### - AssemblyAI API key  
  ### - OpenAI API key  
  ### - Gmail OAuth2 account  
 ### - Replace placeholders (e.g., `<<YOUR_EMAIL ID>>`, `<<YOUR_ASSEMBLYAI_API_KEY>>`) with your  ### own values  
 ### - Run the workflow ‚Äî every Telegram voice message is processed into insights and emailed  ### automatically  

## Requirements

### - Telegram Bot account (API token)  
### - AssemblyAI API key  
### - OpenAI API key  
### - Gmail OAuth2 credentials in n8n  
### - Active n8n instance  

## Need Help?

### Join the [Discord](https://discord.gg/n8n) or ask in the [Forum](https://community.n8n.io)!

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
